communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CBP Promotional Video
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On May 31st Chief Patrol Agent of the U.S. Border Patrol’s Del Rio Sector Robert Danley published a video across official social media accounts about an event where the newly formed Del Rio Sector Mobile Response Team paired up with the Special Operations Detachment for mobile field force training. I am looking for all videos and photographs kept by the department from this training session.  I am also looking for any agendas, memos, scheduling, and training materials provided as part of the training. I am also looking for a munitions load-in and load-out document or other records that reflect the number of munitions used during the training.

As a reporter for the WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record, as required under the the law. If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me or call me - 8053383408 or dhruv_mehrotra@wired.com.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Trading Records Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FinCEN records related to SEC trading review dated May 15, 2002, including any records related to Sept. 11, 2001 securities trading reviews for suspicious activity :

SAR review issue 5 dated Feb 2003 notes: 

Page 38:
FinCEN's staff conducted an analysis of
all SARs submitted by depository institutions, affiliates of depository institutions,
and those voluntarily filed by broker-dealers, MSBs or gaming businesses from
the years 1996 through 2002. These SARs were identified by searching the
narrative section for key words related to the securities industry (e.g., investment
companies, mutual funds, hedge funds, private investment trusts, venture capital
funds, investment advisers). This analysis was not conducted to assess the money
laundering risks associated with securities sector; rather, it was done to provide a
snapshot of what SAR filers were reporting related to the securities industry.

Page 41:

• Five SARs were filed relating to September 11th activity and the OFAC
list of "specially designated global terrorists" — organizations and
individuals engaged in international terrorism. Two SARs identified
activity of investment companies on the OFAC list. Three SARs described
activity of individuals or entities on the OFAC list that included
transactions involving investment companies.

https://www.fincen.gov/sites/default/files/sar_report/sar_tti_05.pdf

Please review page 17 and 24 in SAR review issue 4 dated August 2002 for any possible relevant records: 

https://www.fincen.gov/sites/default/files/sar_report/sar_tti_04.pdf

Please review MFR03011148 dated 11/07/03 for possible relevant FinCEN records to the request:

https://www.scribd.com/doc/79611715/t4-b12-Mfr-Fincen-Knez-Judith-2003-11-05

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan

Secret Service records of briefings and involvement in the SEC trading review dated May 15, 2002.

Pg. 7 from FBI Team 4 files dated 8/14/03 notes Secret Service access to the investigation:

" spoke to a United States Secret Sevice (USSS) , New York, regarding a rumor that he was trying to track down that there had been a sizeable transaction in 5 year Treasury notes between August 27, and September 4, 2001 "

"The Wall Street Journal reported on October 2 that the ongoing investigation by the SEC into suspicious stock trades had been joined by a Secret Service probe into an unusually high volume of five-year US Treasury note purchases prior to the attacks. The Treasury note transactions included a single $5 billion trade."
https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2001/10/bond-o05.html

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Trading Records Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

DOJ records related to SEC trading review dated May 15, 2002, including DOJ records related to Seisint Inc. involvement with the investigation.

Page 2 notes DOJ involvement in the investigation:
https://unredacted.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/9-11-sec-report.pdf

Page 9 of MFR03010885 dated 9/16/03 states:

"At the conclusion of the investigation, the SEC gave DOJ a CD containing all the
relevant trades the SEC and the SROs had found. Cella then accompanied Paul Johns of
DOJ and FBI agent Gurvais Grigg to Seisint, a DOJ contractor based in Virgina, where
Seisint's computer experts "sliced and diced" the data on its powerful computers to
generate a series of reports. Johns, Grigg, and Cella reviewed these reports, which
revealed no evidence of illicit trading. Cella said the CD contained all of the trading
information obtained through the blue-sheeting process, which is a tremendous amount of
data."

https://cryptome.org/nara/sec/sec-03-0916.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Alan

title: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports (Dr. William W. Henderson Inclusion School)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports (Dr. William W. Henderson Inclusion School)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c. 66, §10, for public records in the custody of your organization. The Center for Public Interest Advocacy & Collaboration is an educational, research, and advocacy organization at Northeastern University School of Law. We produce publicly available interdisciplinary research and data analysis on important social issues.

We request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1.	Cross-tabulated counts of 51A reports filed against children ages 3-18 in school years 2022-2023, 2023-2024 broken down by
a.	Category of reporter (mandated or non-mandated) 
b.	Age of the child 
c.	Race of the child
d.	Ethnicity of the child
e.	Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child 
f.	Disability status of the child 
g.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
2.	Intersectional counts of 51A reports filed against parents in school years 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
a.	Race of the parent
b.	Ethnicity of the parent
c.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
3.	The standard operating procedures of the Office of Equity at Dr. William W. Henderson Inclusion School and its role in creating and maintaining procedures for mandatory reporting and filing of 51As since its inception 

We requested the same records from the Department of Children and Families of Massachusetts on May 17, 2024, and have yet to receive a response. 

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all associated fees be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). If you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Norrie Osgood
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law
osgood.n@northeastern.edu 
(603) 848-2018

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

On January 17, 1980, 21-year-old Helene Pruszynki was found stabbed to death in a field near Daniels Park Road. She had been abducted near her bus stop in Englewood, Colorado the night prior and she had also been sexually assaulted. In 2019, James Curtis Clanton was arrested for Helene’s murder, and he was sentenced to life in prison in 2020.  According to detectives in this case the department used a forensic psychic or a subject under hypnosis, among other tools, to help hunt down Prusynski's murderer.  I am looking for records reflecting the number of cases psychics or hypnosis has been used by the department since the year 2000.  Such records should include contracting records as well as investigatory records produced by the forensic psychic or the hypnosis .

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Access to and copies of all records held by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department related to Joseph Friese. 

Specifically, I am requesting the following information:

- Any and all records, reports, and documents related to Joseph Friese, including but not limited to, any criminal investigations, arrests, or incidents involving him.
- Any search warrants and affidavits issued for properties associated with Joseph Friese.
- Incident reports and any documentation created by officers in connection with Joseph Friese.
- Records of any evidence collected, including logs and lists, from any investigations involving Joseph Friese.
- Communication records, including emails and internal memos, discussing Joseph Friese.
- Any video or audio recordings from body cameras, dash cameras, or surveillance cameras involving Joseph Friese.
- Booking records, mugshots, and arrest information for Joseph Friese.

I am particularly interested in any records related to an alleged raid on a mushroom growing operation, potentially connected to a defunct Instagram account "@agarmyco1" although this request is not limited to that incident alone. Time frame is assumed to be between 2010 and 2020, but may be outside this period. 

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: National Weather Service: Social media settings and Facebook comments

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: National Weather Service: Social media settings and Facebook comments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook page located at https://www.facebook.com/NWS. An example of what each of these records look like is attached and available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/NWS/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu. 

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users" 
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages" 
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/NWS/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/NWS/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/NWS/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/NWS/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

9. For each of the "THREADS" identified below, a copy of any hidden comments, with all comments expanded, as visible when logged in as the page. The records of the hidden comments on the full thread may be accessed through this process:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Navigate to the url of the thread.
(c) Make sure you are interacting with the page as the page: Click the down-pointing arrow next to the user icon (located near the top of the thread, to the right of the "Like," "Comment," and "Share" buttons) and, on the "Choose How to Interact" menu, select the name of the page.
(d) Click "Most Relevant" (or "Newest" or "All Comments" or "Hidden by This Page") and, on the menu, select "Hidden by This Page".
(e) Make sure the thread is fully expanded: Scroll through the comments and click the links reading "1 reply," "replies," or "View more comments" to expand the thread.

For purposes of this request, "THREADS" means and refers to the posts located at:
(a) https://www.facebook.com/NWS/posts/pfbid02BdA15Qksec3qFXU6zJzKTYephbfYUG3gba3YJBYRJH7A6Zb2WhRKcLz6ZCRq3RRl

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Request – Information on Afro-German Children in the Rhineland

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request – Information on Afro-German Children in the Rhineland
communications.communication:
Date: May 31, 2024

National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, MD 20740-6001

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Information on Afro-German Children in the Rhineland

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the National Archives and Records Administration pertaining to Afro-German children born to French-African soldiers and German women during the post-World War I occupation of the Rhineland, from January 1, 1920, to December 31, 1950. This request includes both classified and unclassified documents, as well as records pending declassification.

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

	1.	Folders and Indexes: Any folders, indexes, or finding aids for records related to Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	2.	Declassified Documents: Any declassified documents, reports, or communications related to Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	3.	Classified and Pending Declassification Documents: Any classified documents or those pending declassification that pertain to Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	4.	Transcripts: Transcripts of communications between U.S. government entities and German authorities concerning Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	5.	Investigations: Records of any investigations or assessments conducted by U.S. agencies involving Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	6.	Correspondences: Correspondences between U.S. government officials discussing Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	7.	Social Reports: Documents and reports on the social and economic conditions of Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	8.	Military Records: Information on U.S. military observations and activities related to Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	9.	Cultural Exchanges: Records of cultural exchange programs or collaborations involving Afro-German children in the Rhineland.
	10.	Human Rights Assessments: Documents related to human rights assessments or impact studies involving Afro-German children in the Rhineland.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980). Additionally, per the Presidential Records Act (44 U.S.C. Chapter 22) and Executive Order 13526 (Classified National Security Information), agencies are required to appropriately handle records of historical interest.

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government. The public interest standard is further supported by the criteria established in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)). Given the complexity and scope of this request, I understand it may take additional time to process. Therefore, I request an update on the status of my request within thirty business days. I am willing to accommodate a one-time extension, provided that I am informed in advance with a specific time frame for the extension.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: FOIA Request - Investments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hope hello this finds you well. I am currently seeking updated quarterly performance data from your plan’s alternative asset holdings for the following date(s): 1Q2013 till 1Q2024.
As always, thank you in advance for the time you take in sending me the responsive documents, and below follows the formal request:
On behalf of PitchBook Data, Inc., under Tennessee Open Records Act, I request a copy of the quarterly public records from 1Q2013 till 1Q2024 for the following information, preferably in Excel or PDF format.
1. Names and vintage years of all private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships in City of Memphis Retirement System's portfolio.
2. Commitments made to each partnership.
3. Contributions drawn down since inception.
4. Distributions made to City of Memphis Retirement System to date by each individual partnership.
5. Net Asset Value of each partnership.
6. Internal rates of return (IRRs) for each partnership with and without the use of credit facility. Please note if the IRRs are not net.
7. Investment multiple (TV/PI) for each individual partnership.
8. The dollar amount of “total management fees and costs paid” for each individual partnership.
9. Date as of which all the above data was calculated.
10. Names of all alternative asset partnerships partially and fully sold by City of Memphis Retirement System, including date of sale.
11. For each fund, please indicate whether or not the fund uses Subscription Credit Facilities.
I also request a copy of any disclosable documents which contain some or all of the following information:
12. Names of all hedge fund holdings (including hedge fund of funds) in City of Memphis Retirement System's portfolio.
13. Month by Month Market Value for each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since City of Memphis Retirement System's initial investment up to 1Q2013 till 1Q2024.
14. Month by Month Contributions to each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since City of Memphis Retirement System's initial investment up to 1Q2013 till 1Q2024.
15. Month by Month Returns (net of fees) earned by City of Memphis Retirement System for each hedge fund holding (including hedge fund of funds) since initial investment up to 1Q2013 till 1Q2024.
16. Investment memorandum used by the City of Memphis Retirement System investment committee and investment consultants providing consultation to the City of Memphis Retirement System regarding private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships being considered for investment by the City of Memphis Retirement System portfolio.
17. All due diligence materials and presentation materials produced by the General Partners in the course of the City of Memphis Retirement System conducting due diligence on investments into any private equity, venture capital, mezzanine, distressed, real estate/REIT, debt and infrastructure partnerships.
18. For each fund, please indicate whether or not the fund uses Subscription Credit Facilities.
If there are any fees for searching for, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before you task the request. If you deny all or any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.
Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions. My full contact information is listed below.
Thank you in advance for your help on this request.
Jidnyasa Solanki

• Phone Number: 520-247-9215
• Internal Tracking #58569-31

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Jake Hujar.

communications.subject: New Message :: R004224-053124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
This email shall acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) request, directed to the MTA. 

This is to advise you that we are in the process of reviewing our files for the records you requested and anticipate being able to furnish you with your response on or before 8/30/2024.  Access to any record requested will be determined in accordance with the Public Officers Law. 

Please be advised that the MTA FOIL Unit receives a high volume of FOIL requests ranging from simple to complex requests and all documents and records require review prior to disclosure. As a result, documents and records will not be immediately available. Under certain circumstances of the request, such as, the number of documents requested, their format, their availability, the time it takes to review and redact any information that cannot be disclosed pursuant to FOIL, the time it takes to assemble the documents, and other factors, processing and response times may be delayed. Since the time and effort required to complete a response can vary significantly, the MTA endeavors to complete each request in a time period that is reasonable under the circumstances of the request. 

Regards, 
MTA FOIL Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 8200Who

Thank you!
- Martin Peck

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/lapdhq/?sk=professional_dashboard

I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu. 

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users" 
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages" 
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/lapdhq/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/lapdhq/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/lapdhq/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/lapdhq/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Department of Defense support for unknown entertainment project "Comic Culture"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for unknown entertainment project "Comic Culture"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of "Comic Culture," a title which appears on an attached list, released to me through FOIA by DoD, of TV and movie productions supported by DoD in 2023. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "Comic Culture." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Comic Culture," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Department of Defense support for upcoming Joseph Kahn film "ICK!," starring Brandon Routh and Mena Suvari

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for upcoming Joseph Kahn film "ICK!," starring Brandon Routh and Mena Suvari
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the upcoming movie "ICK!," directed by Joseph Kahn and starring Brandon Routh and Mena Suvari. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "ICK!." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "ICK!," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Attached is a list, released to me through FOIA by DoD, of TV and movie productions supported by DoD in 2023; "ICK!" is included on that list.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
